unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss It, Like That Auto Rickshaw in Dadar!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss It, Like That Auto Rickshaw in Dadar!

unnormalised: Okay, let's be real. Flash sales. The retail equivalent of trying to catch a glimpse of Shah Rukh Khan at Mannat. You're hyped, you're ready, and BAM! Gone in a flash, leaving you wondering if it even happened.
normalised: Okay, let's be real. Flash sales. The retail equivalent of trying to catch a glimpse of Shah Rukh Khan at Mannat. You're hyped, you're ready, and B A M! Gone in a flash, leaving you wondering if it even happened.

unnormalised: Here at Retail Rascals, we've seen it all. Aunties clashing over discounted sarees at Linking Road. Uncles sprinting for that last pressure cooker deal at Big Bazaar. It's a battlefield out there, folks!
normalised: Here at Retail Rascals, we've seen it all. Aunties clashing over discounted sarees at Linking Road. Uncles sprinting for that last pressure cooker deal at Big Bazaar. It's a battlefield out there, folks!

unnormalised: But why the madness? Why do these blink-and-you-miss-it extravaganzas work? Well, it’s the good ol' FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out), my friend! Dr. Sharma from our marketing team says it triggers our "monkey brain" – the part of us that MUST have the shiniest bauble, even if we don’t need a third pressure cooker.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: you see a notification for 70% off on that fancy new kurta you've been eyeing. You have 3 hours. Do you a) contemplate the existential implications of fast fashion, or b) throw your laptop open and hit "buy now" faster than Rajinikanth dodging bullets? We all know the answer.

Do you a) contemplate the existential implications of fast fashion, or b) throw your laptop open and hit "buy now" faster than Rajinikanth dodging bullets? We all know the answer.

unnormalised: And companies? They LOVE it. They clear out old inventory faster than you can say "Diwali sale!" They generate buzz, get new customers, and generally feel like they're running a successful business, even if they’re practically giving away that inflatable pool they couldn't shift last summer (remember the monsoon floods? That pool’s probably somewhere near Pune now).

unnormalised: So, are flash sales worth it? Maybe. Just remember to hydrate, wear comfortable shoes (especially if you're tackling Sarojini Nagar), and prepare for the digital equivalent of a Mumbai local train at peak hour. Oh, and check if the price is actually a good deal. Sometimes, that "70% off" turns out to be more like a Rs. 5 discount on a Rs. 10,000 item. We've seen it happen!

unnormalised: Plus, ensure the seller is legit. You don't want to end up with a kurta made of recycled newspaper instead of that fancy silk. After all, nobody wants to attend Mrs. Verma’s kitty party in an outfit that feels like 10 sq ft of yesterday’s headlines. Good luck, shoppers! May the fastest clicker win!
